return.desc:
Returns an array of the names of the declared classes in the current script.

Note that depending on what extensions you have compiled or loaded into PHP, additional classes could be present. This means that you will not be able to define your own classes using these names. There is a list of predefined classes in the Predefined Classes section of the appendices.
Returns an array of the names of the declared interfaces in the current script.
Returns an array of the names of the declared traits in the current script.

funcs.name: class_exists
funcs.desc: This function checks whether or not the given class has been defined.

return.desc: Returns TRUE if class_name is a defined class, FALSE otherwise.

args.name: class_name
args.desc: The class name. The name is matched in a case-insensitive manner.

args.name: autoload
args.desc: Whether or not to call __autoload by default.

funcs.name: interface_exists
funcs.desc: Checks if the given interface has been defined.

return.desc: Returns TRUE if the interface given by interface_name has been defined, FALSE otherwise.

args.name: interface_name
args.desc: The interface name

args.name: autoload
args.desc: Whether to call __autoload or not by default.

funcs.name: trait_exists
funcs.desc: Checks if the given trait has been defined.

return.desc: Returns TRUE if the trait given by trait_name has been defined, FALSE otherwise.

args.name: trait_name
args.desc: The trait name

args.name: autoload
args.desc: Whether to call __autoload or not by default.

return.desc: Returns an array of method names defined for the class specified by class_name. In case of an error, it returns NULL.

args.name: class_or_object
args.desc: The class name or an object instance

funcs.name: get_class_vars
funcs.desc: Get the default properties of the given class.

return.desc: Returns an associative array of declared properties visible from the current scope, with their default value. The resulting array elements are in the form of varname => value.

args.name: class_name
args.desc: The class name

funcs.name: get_class_constants
funcs.desc: Get the constants of the given class.

return.desc: Returns an associative array of constants with their values.

args.name: class_name
args.desc: The class name

funcs.name: get_class
funcs.desc: Gets the name of the class of the given object.

return.desc:
Returns the name of the class of which object is an instance. Returns FALSE if object is not an object.

If object is omitted when inside a class, the name of that class is returned.

args.name: object
args.desc: The tested object. This parameter may be omitted when inside a class.

funcs.name: get_parent_class
funcs.desc: Retrieves the parent class name for object or class.

return.desc:
Returns the name of the parent class of the class of which object is an instance or the name.

If the object does not have a parent FALSE will be returned.

If called without parameter outside object, this function returns FALSE.

args.name: object
args.desc: The tested object or class name

funcs.name: is_a
funcs.desc: Checks if the given object is of this class or has this class as one of its parents.

return.desc: Returns TRUE if the object is of this class or has this class as one of its parents, FALSE otherwise.

args.name: class_or_object
args.desc: The tested object

args.name: class_name
args.desc: The class name

args.name: allow_string
args.desc: If this parameter set to false (default), string class name as object is not allowed. This also prevents from calling autoloader if the class doesn't exist.

funcs.name: is_subclass_of
funcs.desc: Checks if the given object has the class class_name as one of its parents.

return.desc: This function returns TRUE if the object object, belongs to a class which is a subclass of class_name, FALSE otherwise.

args.name: class_or_object
args.desc: A class name or an object instance

args.name: class_name
args.desc: The class name

args.name: allow_string
args.desc: If this parameter set to false, string class name as object is not allowed. This also prevents from calling autoloader if the class doesn't exist.

funcs.name: method_exists
funcs.desc: Checks if the class method exists in the given object.

return.desc: Returns TRUE if the method given by method_name has been defined for the given object, FALSE otherwise.

args.name: class_or_object
args.desc: An object instance or a class name

args.name: method_name
args.desc: The method name

funcs.name: property_exists
funcs.desc:
This function checks if the given property exists in the specified class.

As opposed with isset(), property_exists() returns TRUE even if the property has the value NULL.

return.desc: Returns TRUE if the property exists, FALSE if it doesn't exist or NULL in case of an error.

args.name: class_or_object
args.desc: The class name or an object of the class to test for

args.name: property
args.desc: The name of the property

funcs.name: get_object_vars
funcs.desc: Gets the accessible non-static properties of the given object according to scope.

return.desc: Returns an associative array of defined object accessible non-static properties for the specified object in scope. If a property have not been assigned a value, it will be returned with a NULL value.

args.name: object
args.desc: An object instance.

args.name: method_name
args.desc: The method name being called.

args.name: obj
args.desc: The object that method_name is being called on.

args.name: paramarr
args.desc: An array of parameters.

args.name: method_name
args.desc: The method name being called.

args.name: obj
args.desc: The object that method_name is being called on.
